description.en: In lectures, we will give an overview of cross-cultural studies in psychology. We will address topics like values, ethnic groups, personality, socialization, language and communication, social behavior in a cross-cultural perspective. We will discuss why behavior and many psychological processes differ across cultures and what it means for theory and practice in psychology.
description.et: Loengutes antakse ülevaade võrdlevatest kultuuri-uuringutest psühholoogia valdkonnas. Käsitleme teemasid nagu väärtused, etnilised grupid, isiksus, sotsialiseerimine, keel ja suhtlus, sotsiaalne käitumine kultuuriti võrdlevas perspektiivis. Arutleme teemal,  miks käitumine ja mitmed psühholoogilised protsessid erinevates kultuurides erinevad ja mida see tähendab psühholoogia teooria ja rakenduse jaoks.

objectives.en: The course aims to give an overview of how culture shapes human development, cognition, and behavior.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda sissejuhatav ülevaade sellest, kuidas kultuur mõjutab inimese arengut, kognitiivseid protsesse ja käitumist.

learning_outcomes.en: Student who has passed the course
1)	knows and is able to analyze universal and culture-specific aspects of psychological functioning;
learning_outcomes.et: 1)	teab ja oskab analüüsida psühholoogilise funktsioneerimise universaalseid ja kultuurispetsiifilisi aspekte;

learning_outcomes.en: 2)	knows cross-cultural research methods and issues related to cross-cultural studies;
learning_outcomes.et: 2)	teab kultuuriti võrdlevate uuringute meetodeid ja läbiviimise põhimõtteid;

learning_outcomes.en: 3)	is able to analyze how culture affects his/her behavior and psychological processes.
learning_outcomes.et: 3)	oskab analüüsida kultuuri mõju oma käitumisele ja psühholoogilistele protsessidele.

description.et:
RESEARCH PAPER (50 points)

The paper can be done individually or in a group (maximum of 3 people).

Choose one psychological phenomenon that you are interested in and interview a person who has a different cultural background than you. In your paper, discuss similarities and differences between your culture and that of your interviewee in terms of the psychological phenomenon you chose. 

Some examples of possible topics are conflict management, learning styles and study motivation, happiness and life satisfaction, gender roles, decision-making, personality, mental health, interpersonal relationships, language, communication, etc.

Your paper should include (1) Introduction, where you explain what (i.e., your research questions) and why you are going to examine; (2) Method, where you describe the demographic information of the interviewee, the time and place of the interview, the outline of questions you used in the interview and other methods if necessary; (3) Results and Discussion, where you summarize the answers of the interviewee and discuss them in relation to the theoretical literature; (4) Conclusion, where you summarize your main points; (5) References, where you include at least 8 relevant research papers; (6) Appendix, where the interview content is provided.

Your paper should be approximately 5 double-spaced pages in length (maximum 8 pages), excluding references and interview transcript, formatted using 12-point Times New Roman font. For the parts that are not explained here, follow the APA format.

GRADING CRITERIA:
Clearness of the research question, 10 points
Which topic are you addressing (e.g., mental health. language and mind, personality)? Which cultures are you comparing? Do you write them in the introduction?

Logic and structure of the paper, 15 points
Is the paper easy to follow? Does each paragraph only make one statement? Do you need subsections in some of the sections?

Comprehensiveness and depth of the discussion, 20 points
Have you included both similarities and differences? Are you discussing the phenomenon in relation to the relevant literature? Do you correctly understand the literature you're citing? Do you include some detailed information in the literature rather than just copying their abstract? How can you interpret what you observed from your interviewee from a cross-cultural psychological perspective rather than just superficially describing the observations? 

Format, 5 points
Are you following APA 7th?

NB! 
- Group work only needs to be submitted by one group member. Make sure that you list the names of all group members in the paper. If you want to be sure that I receive the paper and that I won't miss any group members, you can write an email notifying me about the submission.
- You can upload a separate audio file as an appendix if you record the interview. If you conduct the interview in written format (e.g., via email), please include your questions and the interviewee's answers as a text appendix in the paper, after references.
- The interview and appendix can be in languages other than English, but the paper must be written in English.

REFLECTIVE LEARNING DIARY (15 points)
After each study week, you are asked to reflect on the importance and the applicability of the topics covered in the lecture in the Moodle environment. There will be five reflective learning diaries in total (3 points each).

FINAL TEST (35 points)
The test will be in the Moodle environment and available between 17–24 April. The duration of the test will be one hour, and you can only have one attempt. There are multiple-choice questions and open questions requiring 1-2 sentences or 1-2 paragraphs of answers.

grade_preconditions.et: Your performance will be evaluated along three dimensions: a research paper, reflective learning diary assignments in Moodle, and a test.

grade_evaluation.et:
The final grade = research paper (50 points), reflective learning diary (15 points), test (35 points).

91-100 points = A (excellent)
81-90 points = B (very good) 
71-80 points = C (good)
61-70 points = D (satisfactory)
51-60 points = E (passable)
0-50 points = F (failed)

debt_elimination.et:
Research paper: Submission deadline May 1st. Late submissions are not accepted.
Reflective learning diary: The reflective learning diary after each study week must be submitted before the start of the next lecture. Late submissions are not accepted.
Test: Students who do not pass are eligible to retake the test.
